Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bchIRWuaeOoPx73BUQIuBQ.text: Good friends of my husband and mine moved to Greenfield this weekend, and we decided to grab drinks together at Hough's after an evening of drinking at First Friday at the Frick. A lot of people have talked up Hough's, so I was very excited to finally try this establishment.  Since I had already had too many drinks while hanging out at First Friday, I decided to skip the beer and just ordered some appetizers. Our waitress was nice, and made sure to let us know that the kitchen would be closing shortly. We quickly ordered Beer Cheese Nachos with Pulled Pork, Fries, and Cheesecake. When all the food arrived, we immediately dug into the nachos. I took a couple bites and thought, what is that odd flavor? My husband quickly assessed that the chef had not wanted to take the time to properly heat our nachos, and instead melted the cheddar cheese with a butane torch. The cheese had a strong... mmm... gasoline flavor. Disgusting! We mentioned the issue to our waitress, who took 50% off the price of the nachos. In retrospect, we should have demanded the appetizer to be completely removed.  Obviously, the nachos were one of the worse things I've ever eaten. Sadly, the other items did not redeem the nachos either. The fries were limp and cold, while the cheesecake was nice but was obviously not prepared at Hough's.  Outside of the nacho debacle, the beer selection seemed extensive, and I liked the bar's environment. I would be willing to come back... but will never be ordering those nachos again.

966jIkPkvVAbMWvCLRsIcg.text: I came into Hough's without looking at Yelp at all.  I am shocked that in Greenfield this little bar even exists.  Pittsburgh has some of the most craptastic bars in the world.  People will go to just about any bar here.  Let's talk about why Hough's is one of the only good bars in Pittsburgh.  An Actually Amazing Beer Selection-  Most people in Pittsburgh go on about the great selection of beers at bars.  This tends to mean they have Yuengling AND Miller Lite.  I'm not impressed.  But Hough's... OH MAN.  It's a fantastic selection of beers from all over, and they have a nice variety of sizes as well.  So you can get shooter sizes of a variety of beers to sample more than a few!  Awesome.  No smoking- THANK YOU.  Since smelling like an ash tray is such an attractive attribute.  Go Hough's.  Clean-  Yeah.  Bathrooms were clean, floor was clean.  Plates were clean.  Christmas miracle.  Atmosphere- Friendly!  People were ready to chat and have a good time!  I wasn't as impressed with the food as everything else.  I got some kind of beer mac and cheese that was just ok.  Nothing special.  So Hough's can't satisfy my bar food cravings.  But otherwise, this place is a freaking gem.  Thumbs up, Hough's.  I like you.  Call me.

cnlX9uEGdrv_DpJItKAkqg.text: I could have sworn I wrote a reveiw for Hough's over two years ago, but I guess not. Its probably a good thing because I had been asked to leave once or twice around 8pm (or earlier) because "it was slow and they were closing early" and was a little bitter for a while. Good thing I live like a mile away and have been to Hough's maybe 25+ times since then.   Besides the amazing beer selection (200+ bottles and so many on draft), I like Hough's food. Someone who joined me for brunch this morning pointed out "how nice it is that they have so many vegetarian options for being a bar." They have so many good breakfast dishes, most you can sub veggie sausage for, and two breakfast dishes come with VEGETARIAN GRAVY. Holy moly have I missed gravy since giving up most meat, and I am so grateful that Hough's was able to give gravy back to me (meat free). They also have a create your own bloody mary bar with multiple choices of infused vodka to start with. The only time I've been disappointed at breakfast was when I got an eggs benedict type dish and the eggs were cooked all of the way through. They replaced the entree and ended up giving us a discount.  I also recommend their burgers (veggie or otherwise), tater tots, and pretzels.  Hough's is usually a great place to get a beer and some good food, no matter what time of day you head in. The service is generally really good and the place is really bright and clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Our two breakfasts being shared
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing crab cake benedict
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Keep the mug brunch

1y2Cm2FKsf5ihHeP44xKrw.text: As we pulled up this past Sunday morning my son in law stated that this is a kid friendly bar. Knowing that you just can't find enough kid friendly bars I was interested in going in.    We (family of 5) were going for the brunch which was great! Server was excellent, except he didn't know what brand of smoker was in the basement,food was excellent, and all the kids were well behaved. ( only 2, one of which was with us and is only 4 weeks old.). Place was very clean and again, the food was excellent!  I'll be stopping in next time I'm in Pittsburgh for sure!

Su4peXEj_h3LjIaf1t5uMg.text: Honestly, you can't get much better than Hough's if you are a fan of delicious beer.  And oh, yes, delicious food.  But let's focus on the beer first.  Hundreds of options of every beer you can imagine from any region.  Many, many choices on tap but an unbelievable bottle selection.  And then do there darn tootin best to serve you the beer you choose in a glass tumbler bearing the name of said beer.  It's the little things that make places special.    I've eaten here many times and have enjoyed crab cakes, burgers, wraps, and excellent appetizers.  Hough's has put Greenfield on the map.

B0fFvWiSYug458-R6ijM2w.text: Hough's has only continued evolve and impress; with its food menu, drought options and staff service. There is not one bad thing on the menu, and it continues to have small edits and/or additions that make it easy to find something new or appealing. If you can handle the heat, get their spicy burger with a side of tater tots to cool off! The staff always seems to be knowledgeable about the beer/breweries being served to help you find something new to try! I have been coming here for years and am only excited to see how it continues to grow and change; its unique with a comfortable 'hometown' atmosphere. Love this place!

EuFWgiAV06OskT0TpjQSyQ.text: Hough's is a family run bar and restaurant with some of the most creative extras in all of Pittsburgh.  For the beer drinker, they have 100s of bottled beers and on the order of 50 on tap at any one time.  They are one of the few bars in the U.S. to have an annex where customers can pay to brew their own recipes.  If you are not a beer drinker, they also have a nice selection of wines and spirits and for people like myself soft drinks.  Free refills on diet cokes  The staff is friendly and caring and take joy in making their establishment a haven for fun events.  Brunch before Steelers games, trivia nights, beer tastings, etc.  add to the attractions here.  With many big screen TVs this is the place to watch a Steelers, Penguins, or Pirates game.   On a sports quiet evening, there is a jukebox for music.  In the warm months Hough's sponsors some outside events which attract many locals and their families. Hough's has an upstairs and downstairs bar with two of the most beautiful wood bar surfaces in Pittsburgh.  The bar decor is eclectic including sports decor, a CMU buggy,  and from time to time books from local authors. The crowd attracted tend to be graduate students, professionals from the universities,  participants in the Pittsburgh Sports League, locals, etc.  They have an excellent bar menu which changes periodically to add variety.  They are not afraid to experiment.  It is therefore fun to come back from a hiatus to see what has evolved.  This is a happening place full of friendly people and trend-setting ideas.  It is a Pittsburgh icon and a must visit.  They get SRO crowds for Pens games and Steelers Sunday's.  Why not become a regular and make some great friends.   My highest recommendation for Hough's.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 18 taps
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy Pens fans tonight
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Go Pens!

nh3wc7dt6UxOoPba_ey1Sw.text: When we have a group, or at least a picky one (other than me) in the group, we come to Hough's ("Huff's", yaknow).  Recently moving to Greenfield, it is literally the only actual place to eat in our little hilltop community. And the crowd is Greenfield--empty nesters, graduate students, young couples--never too crowded unless it's trivia night. And Tuesday trivia night is serious.   I am admittedly not a beer drinker, but I'm serious on some cider. Hough's absolutely has one of the largest bottled cider lists I've seen in the city. McKenzie's cherry is one I haven't been typically able to order in a bar elsewhere, and it is my favorite(!!!!). Obviously the beer lists are even more impressive. The only odd thing from most places I like is the lack of cocktails. That's just not what they do here; it's a neighborhood bar. There was a tiny laminated drink list at one point but I was told it was rubbish, and they didn't have anything that was listed in the drinks. Yikes.  If you have time for food (sometimes it can be a little slow), definitely give it a chance.  Tots! A side of tots is my jam. It's inexpensive, casual, great for weekend lunch. It's a lowkey sports bar without the obnoxiousness. The only downside (other than people bringing their children here), would be the hours. 4 until midnight for a bar/restaurant here is tough. Weekend hours are normal, but scuttling out at 11:30 the rest of the week is a bit annoying.  If you make it to Greenfield for some reason (took the wrong exit off 376?), Hough's is a super casual neighborhood spot worth the stop.

mjCrWPoCVZQdRiq1j-UIAA.text: I went here for brunch and the food was good but the service was very disappointing. Although there  weren't that many customers but the food took so long to come out and our  waitress was very absent-minded. The place is very spacious, and I think it should also be good for weekend nights as a pub.

Si4ekLmSYF8UDOMatjxt9Q.text: Great place to grab some beers from all over the U.S. Seems to be a local favorite. Highly recommend to those visiting Pittsburgh and wanting to do something more than the typical tourist attractions.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

zx9_GUqvtyE92U_2Nf7y0Q.text: What a great deal.  Two breakfasts and two drinks.  $28.00  Wwwwhhhhaaaatttt?  And on a Saturday.  Hough's Hash is a heaping helping of hash browns with a bunch of breakfast goodness.  Get to Greenfield.  (Although when I was there all the taps were Flying Dog, :(  I can still dig on their Bloody Mary.

rYhHe5aE8rz4hhy9hw2_Hw.text: Love that it is in the greenfield neighborhood.  Great location....decent food. I wish they would get back to their great beer selection and actually have the beers you order on tap.

BfrDnxM4qvM6LXrq53oqpw.text: Hough's and I go wayyyy back. I was a Hough's regular when they first opened in 2009 and the facade was a mere random wooden door facing Greenfield Ave...no awning, no indication of any business....just a strange hidden gem full of friendly staff, good food, and more beer options than one can imagine.  Unfortunately, this hidden gem didn't stay hidden forever. The awning went up. People started noticing the little bar on the corner. Suddenly, my usual table on Friday nights was constantly occupied by strangers. Over time, service became unfriendly and inattentive.The food quality worsened. It didn't feel like my homey neighborhood bar anymore. Sadly, Hough's and I broke up.  However, I recently saw my old friend Hough's for the first time in 3 years. While some things have changed (no more shuffleboard?!), I am pleased to report that I had a great experience once again. They've completely revamped their menu and the food was delicious! In particular, the buffalo chicken dip was killer...super sharp, flavorful, and just the right amount of spice. Their smoked chicken wings were pretty fantastic as well. And of course, they still have that gargantuan selection of beers. Most importantly, the service was back to being friendly and welcoming. I also see that they're doing all kinds of cool things now like themed brunches, trivia, etc. My little Hough's is all grown up!  Welcome back to my life, Hough's. I've missed you and I'll definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo chicken dip
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked chicken wings

OaJNvgVKsh7s1CpnJP4D0w.text: Hough's is a hidden gem of Greenfield and an awesome brunch spot! I'm not a fan of bloody Mary's, but a close friend says their build your own bar on Sundays is the best around. Their menu for both brunch and lunch and dinner is delicious! I love that they feature a new brewery monthly and serve a wide variety of their beer in addition to their regular beer selection. There is also a create your own brewery attached to Hough's which is also an awesome experience! Service typically tends to be pretty slow, but I keep going back for the quaint atmosphere and comfortable feeling.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Who doesn&#39;t like a witty coffee mug?

-jn_blze2KNOXKJuHDh41A.text: Each time I'm here the place is packed. Fun bar in Greenfield that is just all kinds of everything. Seriously if you like beer most especially craft beers/IPA then look no further. What I like about it is that you're not gouged price wise just because it's a certain type of pour.  Another reason to like this place are the various brew related events they have. In addition they serve good food and have a nice staff.

PvTrzVxr6irRitgyr1Imuw.text: I was pleasantly surprised by Hough's as I expected much more of a typical divey sports bar vibe. It's very nice inside! If you enjoy craft beer, this is definitely a place you need to check out.  Myka was our server and she was great. We were there with quite a large party of 15-20 people and she was extremely attentive all night and took great care of us with getting us all drinks and food.  Besides having TONS of different drafts, they have a great variety of bottles as well. Their menu is broken up by different categories of beer so it's easy to find what you want. They offer flights and different sized pours so you can sample many different types of beers. They also have great $3 bottle specials. When I was there they had bottles of Flying Dog Bloodline for $3! Great deal!  The food was comparable to most typical bar food. I had a Cajun Burger that was OK. They serve tater tots and you can't go wrong with those! They have Loaded Spuds which are baked potatoes with all kinds of different toppings...definitely want to try one of those next time because it looked amazing!

13RV653AIiEUQAlJyIIpRQ.text: This is one of my favorite places for Sunday brunch. They have good food and a large craft beer selection. They have a Bloody Mary bar, which is my favorite. They offer house-infused vodkas. You pick the vodka and what you would like on the rim and then you get to create a beautiful bloody yourself! One of my favorite Sunday's are the 'keep the mug' brunch. I have quite the collection

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody Mary at Hough&#39;s

QLKInADrieGxsDjSfDbWJw.text: Good for lunch. The nachos that we got to share came in a large portion. We couldn't finish it, so we brought it home. I ordered the Righteous Burger, which was really just your standard burger (didn't see what was so "righteous" about it), with egg on top and tots on the side. Love restaurants that serve tots! My burger was juicy and I liked the bun. Boyfriend got the Philly cheesesteak and thought it was pretty good. Both of us couldn't finish our food not because the portions were particularly large but because we let the nachos and tots fill us up first. Prices here are just about right and our server was very nice. They don't seem too busy for lunch on weekends; only a few other people were there besides us. Will return for the tots.  Taste | 3.5 Atmosphere | 3 Presentation | 3 Service | 4 OVERALL | 3.5

iK_2jV7ROckLtvTu_eobdQ.text: Even though we felt that this place was mailing it in and maybe they did not put their best foot forward, the meal, the food, the beer was still good this evening. Fish sandwich was EPIC. Big flavor. Big volume. Big rating. Buffalo chicken dip was very nice, as was the poutine. We had a Cuban which was as inauthentic and yinzer as you get... but guess what, DELICIOUS!!!!!  This cuban a traditionalist would have vomited and thrown in the garbage but they would have been wrong ... WAY WRONG. White cheddar Mac and cheese was pretty great as well.  Beers were good, everything but the service was good. Service was slow and fairly nonchalant. I guess blame it on Sunday ?

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6du-Jm_reJv4L--1gFbzOw.text: Before indulging in some pumpkin brews, my friends and I stopped in for a bite at Hough's.  I knew they had good beer (obviously), but didn't know about the delicious food!    Browsing the menu, there are burgers, nachos OR Tot-chos  (tots with nacho toppings), even Mac n cheese.  Talk about comfort food!  When my eyes caught the chicken and waffle sandwich, there was no turning back... I was in heaven.  Soft and fluffy waffles embracing the juicy chicken with spicy sauce (perhaps mayo?) with maple syrup on the side to drizzle or dunk you sandwich at your leisure.  Yes, I dunked.  Yes, I wore my maple syrup proudly!  Did I mention this dish came with a side?  When you have chicken and waffles, who needs a side?!  Though I could have selected fries or tots, I opted for the side salad so my full stomach wouldn't inhibit my beer selection.   After cashing out, we went to the Drunkin Pumpkin even.  If you enjoy pumpkin or fall type beers, you must attend this event at least once.  There are 35 beers to sample or just drink your favorites, like Pumking.  At the stroke of midnight (or last call) you will turn into a pumpkin... and you'll be perfectly okay with that.   Thank you Hough's for a great night out with my girls.  I will return soon for more chicken and waffles!  ...what? Don't judge me ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Drunkin Pumpkin brews - one with carmel gingersnap rim - delicious

cOmQmoTPAOXyrztjzRlIpQ.text: My boyfriend took me to brunch last week, refusing to tell me where we were going. The surprise was hough's :). We loved the environment immediately as we walked in! Spacious, tons of TVs and a huge draft list! We went on a Sunday around noon and it wasn't that crowded. We were told to pick any table we wanted, so my boyfriend chose a table with a view of the penguins game, haha.   I knew nothing about this place so I decided to check yelp to see what drink I should order/ what food I should get! I saw that a lot of people raved about their mimosas, so I decided to order one! It was awesome! Blended perfectly, sweet and refreshing flavor and it paired wonderfully with my meal.  The brunch menu is awesome- really unique items like honey nut Cheerios crusted French toast and a chicken and waffle sandwich. They had a separate brunch menu that offered meals and beer pairings! If you order one of those meals, you could keep the mug, pretty cool!   For my main course, I noticed a lot of people raved on yelp about their chicken and waffles. Since I never tried chicken and waffles before, I figured I just had to! Oh.. My.. Goodness! It was insanely good! The chicken and waffles were presented as a sandwich- two fluffy waffles with amazing crispy fried chicken in between. A sweet and spicy sauce was also on the sandwich and syrup to dip! What an awesome sandwich idea for brunch! I was super full after enjoying that! My boyfriend ordered a burger and tots on the side and loved everything , too!   Our server was very friendly and attentive to us throughout our meal. The food came out in a timely manner too :)   We love this place and can't wait to come back to drink some beers and try more of their menu!

Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Heaven!
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken and waffle sandwich! With tots and a burger in the background

ZvrTrYX6MJsxmGh1yGOPuQ.text: Pierogis were great! Went around 10pm, had more of a bar like atmosphere at night, but still is a nice place. You can tell their pierogis are homemade, they taste delicious.

TDcgYUdXmV8wlUB75LZIxQ.text: If you are in the Pittsburgh area, this is a must stop! Came here for their Sunday brunch and was very impressed.  First of all they feature a breakfast flight of select stouts and porters with a coffee for $12. The beers, from Terrapin Brewery's "Wake & Bake" collection were delicious!   The bar boasts a large selection of draught craft beer and monthly will rotate a dedicated set of taps to one brewery. They also have numerous TV's and ample seating. The staff was friendly and courteous.   The food was very good. I had a egg sausage and cheese bagel sandwich and the wife had the huevos ranchero. Everything was fresh, warm and delectable.  They also have featured food items such as homemade doughnuts on the brunch menu.  Overall this is a fantastic place just the city. Grab an uber from the downtown district to Greenfield for approx $9-12.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flight of breakfast stoudts and porters from Terrapin Brewery.

anxQEfU8lKABlS8ZZKM5dw.text: Came here a few weeks ago to watch the pens playoffs. There wasn't a lot of seating available but it wasn't packed, and we managed to grab a small table.  There are a lot of TVs, so that you can see from any angle-they also had a large projector against one wall, but unfortunately the picture was a bit blurry.    I was really surprised at how large the beer selection was--it was actually a bit overwhelming. They have 2 different bars and the one on the lower level has 3 or 4 rows of taps. The atmosphere is pretty much your typical sports bar, maybe a little bit nicer.  It actually seemed like a big Pittsburgh Sports League hangout by the clientele.

Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Upper bar
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lower bar

ka-kp0EyKY5sNtCyYQKoxw.text: Amazing brunch and Bloody Mary bar. We are never disappointed. Great bartender and atmosphere.

kF4CMXrs0xyh7Dy0Rwxlpw.text: Bartender hands me tap list, "I'll have an X".  "That's kicked" bartender.  Me, "Ok, how about Y?"  "No, that's kicked too."   Hough's please keep an up to date draught list or stay out of the craft beer game.  Food was decent.  Staff is slow and not very friendly.

DfCHnddzqfWr9v3K1v_CDg.text: We used to love Hough's.  It used to have excellent food, prompt waitstaff and a great atmosphere.  Over the past year or two, it has declined to a shadow of its former self. It's loud, crowded, the waitstaff have pitiful customer service and the food was just sad.   Our order consisted of a plate of nachos with cheese, pico de gallo and green onions and an order of apple pie pierogies with a side of ice cream.  They were out of apple pie pierogies, and the waitress didn't ask if I wanted  something else, before leaving.  The nachos arrived, the cheese was like cheese sauce, but cold. The "pico de gallo" was basically diced tomatoes and a couple of chives.  It was dry, bland and boring.    Hough's, you've done better.  You've been going downhill for a long time, and this is the last time my fanny will grace one of your seats.  We've tried and tried to give you a chance to redeem yourselves, and we keep getting disappointed.

WKMdDzaZ79OgqbKhReEEQg.text: We ventured to Hough's because of the tap takeover in June, but stayed for dinner. It's a nice neighborhood bar, with a mix of locals and those there (like us) because of the beer. The happy hour special covers most beers on tap, including the tap takeover beers. We ordered the housemate pieogis three ways: poutine, mozzarella and sausage, and dessert (apple pie filling with vanilla ice cream on the side). All were very good. Service was excellent at the bar, and it felt family-friendly. We plan to return.

wTuWgg42CpYfp4MA00aeYA.text: What's not to like about this place? Came here for the fourth time on a whim right before the Penguin game. Got seats at the bar and was promptly waited on by the bartender.  Their food is tremendous and there is so many different kinds of craft beer it will make your head spin! My guess is there is about 70 beers on draft and another 100-150 bottles to choose from. The food is out of this world. I have eaten here four times and it has never let me down. My wife and I ordered the nachos as an appetizer, the Rachel sandwich, and garlic Parmesan wings. Everything was delicious. This is my favorite place in Allegheny County by far! I can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Appetizers and wing list
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. IPA List
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

H6pGe9PwR5M3rR4xEgDHpQ.text: Awful just awful awful service half their beers they don't have and they don't have the toppings for the perogies I wanted... definitely not coming back

EA3eRmB-xYjAxcSeGbjRKg.text: Visited here with a friend last week. The place is very clean and welcoming. The menu is overwhelming with all of the beer choices and the nacho are amazing. I loved that they had vegetarian options on their menu! Can't wait to come back and try brunch!

YnzZiEuFoLhezfWPVRSnwA.text: It's pronounced Huff's. You're already welcome. This is a strange place. It feels like it was a bar once, then they crammed tables in everywhere so that you're going up stairs, down stairs, around other tables, and watch out for dead ends. I was only here 2 weeks ago and it took awhile staring at the menu to remember what I even had. It was chicken and waffles. They were actually quite good, although whatever syrup they give you to pour over it is not maple or even fake maple. It tasted like sugar. Cane syrup? Couldn't complain about the chicken at all, and the waffle held up to it. There were plenty of fries, to where I'm glad I didn't try the poutine appetizer. That would have been overload and likely disappointment - good poutine is found only in Canada or the Canadian parts of NY/New England. You tell me, other reviewers? Wish I could remember the beer I ordered also, since they don't list their tap rotation on the website. I remember it being a little short on the darker beers (though it was summer to be fair), but I found something I liked in the end. Service was good but I think one person's dish took awhile to come out compared to the rest of us. May have even been mine. Verdict: A neighborhood bar that outgrew itself without finding more space. 3.5 stars, rounding up for not remembering enough negatives to take a deduction.

ZHaqNz13HSHUElYTfxJcUg.text: It's tough. Hough's was once one of my favorite places to go on a weekend. We are west of Pittsburgh so I'd say once or twice a month we'd go to Hough's and typically with family. The last couple times we've gone I've come away less likely to return. After this last visit I think we're done.   Saturday night around 6pm and an empty restaurant when it was once bustling at this time is probably a sign others feel the same way. We were brought a pitcher of water that had a strong taste of soap. Food took over a half hour and when it came out my grilled chicken was half the size of my bun.  The manager/owner walked by numerous times. Never said a word, no apology.   Overall the place could use some tlc. It's disappointing seeing it fall off after 10 years of dining here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

c0w0iSTiaH7fRcW2wg3x3A.text: I went to Hough's for the first time as a part of a large happy hour/ networking event. It was a pretty large group but the hosts and waiters were very accommodating. Drinks came out quickly, and the food was great as well.   Wednesday is 75 cent wing night. Pictured below are the Honey Chipotle which were great as well. (I like mine fried hard. Overall great experience with great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Honey Chipotle Wings

8Yt10l72qOGuRee_vFMNFg.text: Hough's used to be a much better food spot.  It remains a great place to have some beers and watch a game.  However the menu and it seems like the cooks have all changed.  They usually have a good selection of beers on tap and bottled.  They also run some great beer specials at times.  On my most recent trip they had a pumpkin ipa on special for $3 which is something you don't see at other places.  Onto the food.  Hough's menu used to consist of several different burgers, all of which were delicious.  However they have recently overhauled their menu, making it significantly more limited.  There is only one burger on the menu now.  I have not had it yet so I cannot speak to that.  On my last trip to Hough's my group all had different types of wings with sides of fries.  First, both the fries and the wings came out almost cold.  Second, they forgot several orders of fries.  The tastes of the various wings were very average, as was their ranch.  On my previous trip I had their pierogies.  These are by far the best option currently on the menu.  I had the bacon jalapeno pierogies and they were delicious.    I will definitely be back to Hough's, but I wish they would step up their overall food game to where it used to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Boneless wings, half boom boom sauce, half buffalo.  Very average.
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jalapeño bacon pierogies.

MZ0WT_AyK4LR5Kvfa6rXJA.text: Love hough's! Classic American bar fare with a flair of Tex-mex and Pittsburgh specialties. Good prices and great beer specials...speaking of beer...excellent selection!!! Nice atmosphere with plenty of beautiful woodwork. Street parking. Always good service.   Make sure u try their brunch - they also have a Bloody Mary bar! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kids burger
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roast beef
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Open face chicken n waffles

uDu4gd5ryNnz2zyZ1ucz3w.text: I came for trivia, stayed for the food. I truly have never had a bad meal here. I usually come on Tuesdays with a big group but the waitresses never seem to get flustered despite how busy it is. I've had the jalapeno bacon cheddar perogies (which were great) and the boneless chicken wings in boom boom sauce. I love how the perogies come with the option of being traditional or fried. The boom boom chicken was so good and so addicting. I crave it like all the time and I can't wait to go back and get it again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Boneless wings with boom boom sauce.

QRdjogMrTNBJOxY7MMO9-A.text: Stopped by here today for my friend's 22nd birthday and it was a blast! We came during happy hour and there were a ton of drafts for $4. I mean a ton! There are so many options and they were so delicious. Personally, I stuck with the Rhinegeist Moose and I loved it a lot.  They also have a $5 cheeseburger special during happy hour apparently so a few of us at our table got that too. A basket of fries was an extra $3 but it was a decent amount of fries. It's just a regular plain cheeseburger with onion, lettuce, and tomatoes. It was tasty, small, but tasty.  Service was really nice and friendly. Our waitress was really accommodating and happily grabbed us a lighter for our birthday candles and even offered to bring us extra plates (but I had brought the plates and utensils). I would love to come here again and try some of the other food on their menu because they sounded delicious! I really enjoyed my time here and the atmosphere was super chill and fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6GALr8887EvVan6FcZdXAA.text: A friend and I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Waffle Bowl that was the special of the night and we were both slightly disappointed. The waiter explained that this special of the night  has lettuce, cheese, boneless chicken wings, covered with buffalo chicken dip, all in a waffle bowl. When the appetizer was brought to us, we realized the boneless chicken wings were basically breaded chicken nuggets with no sauce of any type on them, there was a small amount of buffalo chicken dip on top, and the bowl was pretty small for an item that was meant to be shared. The flavor of the dish was good, but didn't wow me as I hoped. A few of our other friends ordered the jumbo wings and they were great, and the dish was definitely large enough to share. Their beer selection was awesome and had a nice variety. Service here was also very nice and accommodating to our large group.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo Chicken Waffle Bowl

PAV3oXkU_onGWTq9o2ZeTA.text: Truthfully, I was never impressed with the food; but the atmosphere and drinks were good..however, the owner made a derogatory "overweight"  comment about a customer . Its 2019, and he thinks that's appropriate. Maybe you shouldn't drink so much buddy, you're showing who you really are

-pBavPI_0_JHMhIF53vOsQ.text: Disappointed in the service. And my expectations are relatively low for a bar, but it was just that bad. Ignored by waiters, Bar tender kept complaining to customers about how hungover she was, as some sort of excuse for poor service. A shame, because I usually like Hough's.

H7qMVoaAd4_lJVyQbrROGg.text: Arrived at 11:56 on Friday and is supposed to be open til 2. The door is locked but however there are people in the bar drinking. Why advertise the 2 am closing time?

Yof7NEh-cr73OMbRSs86ZQ.text: Stopped in here after an experience In the Escape Room across the street. How convenient it was to just cross the street to Hough's for dinner and drinks!  Hough's is a decently sized bar and restaurant with a huge beer menu and food menu consisting mostly of sandwiches and homemade pierogis. I ordered the chicken and waffle sandwich and it was legit! Honestly, this may be the best way to have chicken and waffles. I got tater tots with the sandwich and the portion size was humongous!   I'm a fan of Hough's for their chicken and waffle sandwich alone, but the huge selection of beer is definitely a plus!

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tater tots
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken and waffle sandwich

Nvp_TiX7XNvPcQVQNCCM4g.text: If you're looking for a great brunch, head to Hough's! The best hash I've ever had. There was a mimosa bar as well

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hough&#39;s hash.

enYt1upyrOBqoR1wBdw31w.text: I've been going to Hough's for years for brunch, trivia night, and other events.  The best part about brunch at Hough's is the bloody mary bar. Not only is the mix one of the best I've ever had (and I have coronated myself as the queen of bloody marys) but you can all add all the flavorings and garnishes that you could ever want.  Stop by for trivia night on Tuesdays!

gwybBOBtlRYdp4aUwkDFug.text: Their appetizers are definitely great and a wide selection of beers. We got the tater nachoes and they were amazing - a huge plate of them. Definitely enough for two to three people. We also got a few other things such as mozzarella sticks and perogies which were also not bad. Also a huge selection of beers on tap. I would come back again here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0udQG-5bxFTKp68Gzyg9Qg.text: Hough's is the place where everybody knows your name, it was our quintessential neighborhood bar. When we lived in Pittsburgh we were there multiple nights a week to enjoy the immense variety of beers and to top it all off the "really huge cans" to take home. Warning: the menu fluctuates, but the tator tots are the beating heart. As long as the tator tots are still there, I will continue to fly in from CA and visit my favorite neighborhood bar. P.S. please bring back the coleslaw menu circa 2013!!

M1MGPWGf7_iPhjZIGWvL8A.text: Words fail me to describe how amazing Houghs is. The value, from service to the delicious chicken and waffles, to the wide array of beverages. The fun doesn't stop there, as I found out that you can host private events at the Copper Kettle, a home brewert style venue perfect for tge most recent celebration I was part of last month. The family, John, Barb, Matt, Greg and, of course, Cassie, are extremely hard working and it shows.   Don't settle for anything. Stop by Houghs to see the difference vs. Any other restaurant for yourself.

mFen6UqY0g1j8LhcR-Xh-g.text: Six of us came here Saturday night around 7:30 pm.  We ordered food and drinks.  Four of us received our complete order.  One person received one of her items and mine never came.  The waiter never came back.  A member of our party hunted down another employee and complained.  My meal came  a half hour later with no explanation and no apology.  The waiter then showed up with the check.  I have never received such ridiculously poor service in my life.  We will never return and I will tell everyone I know how awful the service is at this place.

rWKehACcQKEtx6tCp0INkw.text: I've been here a handful of times with a bunch of friends when they still lived in Pittsburgh. We have usually been in for late night drinks and snacks or in the morning for brunch, and have always enjoyed it. There have always been other customers, but we've never had to wait too long for service or our food. The staff has always been friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. The meal I remember the most here was the msot recent and my favorite, the totchos. These are exactly what you'd think they are, similar to nachos, but with tator tots instead. We added pulled pork onto these, and they were outstanding. Perfect food to start us off for a night of drinking. They carry a solid beer list, always having a good variety of craft brews. Not just a craft beer bar, as there are usually good deals on domestics. When we were here it was $2 for a 20oz Molson, can't beat a deal like that. This is a pretty standard sports bar/pub, but you will not be disappointed. Typical bar food, but way better than your local corner bar. Definitely worth a stop if you're in the area.

bA6g7OFAWgwjRTvAwUHrdA.text: What happened to this place? I used to come here all the time for the unmatched beer selection and the better-than-expected food. Now they've significantly reduced their menu and their beer list. The staff, with a few exceptions, seems uninspired. It's like they're trying to be another janky sports bar. They've completely lost their identity as Pittsburgh&s premier beer spot.

T5M_OuB4R9EkM9wfqcfPoA.text: Hands down, best Reuben I've ever had. Good beer selection, friendly staff, TVs, darts and shuffleboard but most importantly no smoke! I'd definitely frequent if I wasn't just visiting from out of town.

GtBQ2WmpPH2PDaNffSdrVA.text: Beer selection is great, but the food is average at best. I had the crab cake burger, and the bun was so thick and dry that I barely tasted the "burger". Also, I paid $1 extra for guac, and I'd be lucky if they gave me more than a 14 tablespoon. I wouldn't get this again. The truffle fries are okay, but tasted like regular, fresh-cut fries. Nothing out of the ordinary. My husband had the bison burger and also found it underwhelming. $10.50 for these burgers is too much. They need to knock a couple bucks off the price. I could get a kick-butt meal at Piper's Pub for that price! Go to Hough's if you're looking for great beer selection, but skip the food unless you're okay with mediocre, yet overpriced, bar food.

_H8aIYDeCkFIFgtGAuG__w.text: Hough's is one of the best beer bars in town.  HUGE selection of draft and bottled craft beer. Food is pretty good; wings and burgers are both above average.  Very clean inside.  Lots of big TVs on which to watch the game, including a projection screen.  Only basic cable broadcasts, though; I wish they'd spring for some cable packages so they could show a wider variety of games.  Exceedingly friendly owners who recognize and greet you once you've been a few times.  Highly recommended.

BNz8uiglyypxes-Nj149eQ.text: Beer selection is unprecedented in Pittsburgh, great draft list with about 50-60 beers, a lot of great microbrews.  Food is so-so at best.

eyI_r5cJDiNjCIxGtvurPA.text: Initially, I was skeptical. The exterior does NOT do this bar justice. I expected a tight, dingy, Silky-esque inside. It was bright, open, uncrowded, and comfortable. The beer list is phenomenal and inexpensive for the selection. The darts are FREE, which is tremendous. The shuffleboard table is short, but that's OK. Hough's is a Man's world; the only women in the bar are 1/2 of the waitstaff and ladies there accompanying their boys. Not a problem for the happily involved, but not the scene for the scoping. This is my new favorite bar in which to sit and talk to friends.

mzY_9b41Uhe7RuQB6g8Mlw.text: Don't get me wrong, the beer selection is great and I love that you can get "samples" of maybe 3 oz. for about 1.75 before you pick a pint that you may hate.  BUT, and this is the reason I will go elsewhere next time...the overpriced food sucks and at least some of the waitstaff/management is sub-par.  I went early Sat. evening and got wings--garlic parm, greasy and tasteless.  Comes with 2--yes 2 celery pieces, and if u comment on that you will get 2 more pieces, ungraciously handed to you by a surly waiter who looked like he wanted to be anywhere but taking care of customers.  I don't think he smiled once the whole time I was there.  THEN....my meatball sub comes..3 tiny meatballs on a HALF of a hot dog--yes, not hoagie roll but a hot dog bun!  It looked like a kids meal!  Seriously, Subway's $5 footlong is a great deal compared to this!   At least I've never had bad service at Subway!  The manager( ?) came over and said, "I'm sorry you're not having a good time."  Well, to be honest, I was having a fine time, just terrible food!   When I pointed out the measly meatball sub, adding that the beer is great, but the food is less than, she said something like, "well yeah we are known for our beers, the kitchen is kinda secondary."  Ok then maybe you should charge alot less for your kinda secondary food!   Better yet, give it away! To add insult to injury, the bill comes, and instead of comping the sub, like a normal place would do (I took one bite!) they took 1/2 off.  I mean come on...do you want your 3.50 or do you want a satisfied customer who will come back and tell others how the management took good care of you?  So again I called the manager over, again she states (extremely passive aggressive, this one!), "I'm sorry you're not having a good time."  AGAIN, I'm not NOT having a good time, but this is ridiculous.  I didn't eat the sub, what I tasted was terrible, and it's obvious the food is not important here.   She ungraciously agreed to take off the 3.50 and she hopes we will try Hough's again.  Uh, I don't think so, not unless it's JUST for the beer.  But there are plenty of other places in Pittsburgh for great beer and bar food, and nice staff.  It's a shame, because I like to see local places make it, but I don't think you can do that with the kind of food and service I experienced.   Maybe it was an off night, but they were't too busy, it was about 6pm when we got there.  AND this is the second time I've been there, was actually giving it a second try after the first visit a couple of months ago where the small portions of appetizers were greasy and tasteless.  SO..there won't be a third strike!   If they make it on their beers, great, but I won't be supporting them anymore.  Shame.

MwvhnEhfNkEx093qVDBBOQ.text: This is a great place for any beer lover, but is is also a great local bar with additional offerings.  The owner and the friendly, hard-working staff make it a pleasure to come in.  The food is great too!

2O1Wt4S9Cd9aFDApKxSN1A.text: Best Bar in Squirrel Hill.  Even if it's in Greenfield.  Parking is on the street but not too bad.

McJ26eo6tMySkRndOFFGHA.text: Hough's has a very large selection of craft beer on tap (~60ish taps) which frequently changes throughout the season.  The bottle list is also pretty extensive and features breweries from around the world.  Everything on tap can also be purchased in growlers (half gallon jugs) to go.

P5-57rgqlUgCigsNhl3kuQ.text: Had a birthday party here for about 20, and they did a fantastic job!  They had the table set up near the window looking into the adjacent Copper Kettle Brewery (part of the party was doing some brewing) and had a small table nearby with the appetizers we had ordered.  Service from the amazingly extensive beer menu was fast and often, despite the fact that the place was packed due to a Pen's playoff game.  We'll be back often!

c0g1WL8CHCFsify2rXS8ww.text: In a relatively short period of time, Hough's has become Pittsburgh's premier bar for craft beer. Think Sharp Edge but cheaper and less stuffy. There are over 300 beers available, and the drafts come in a variety of sizes for easy sampling. Hough's also has regular specials on craft beer (shout out for $2 off the double-deuces), which is a rarity in most bars.

xnosjc29egYSxaUNBP5mtg.text: I went here last Friday night as bunch of my friends wanted to hang out and partake in their special of the evening: $3 seasonal beers!  Their selection of beer is outstanding, their website says they have over 220 bottled beers and boy I believe it; the list was 4 pages long.  I also just learned from their website that they have on draft Miller Lite, Yuengling and Guinness along with 5 other seasonal brews.  They also serve cocktails, but I didn't have one so I can't comment on them.  When my husband and I arrived we each thought that we had interrupted a private party but we found our friends in the back corner and quickly joined them.  We didn't have enough seats for everyone and one of the servers was kind enough to bring us an extra chair.    We decided to order some food and I got the "Traditional Burger" for 4.99 and my husband got the "Benko Burger" for I think was 6.99,  each came with a side of fries or chips.   Our burgers were super dry (read: WELL done) but he couldn't really tell because his burger was covered in cheese and special chipotle sauce.  The chips where thick, hot, oily and salty and the fries were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  Service was slow but hey, it was a busy Friday night.  The entire time we were there I couldn't relax because the lights were so bright!  I like my bars to have lighting so low if I drop something on the ground I won't be able to find.  Here, however, I was able to see everything in stark detail: the pristine wood floors, the shiny new bar, a noticeable lack of windows--which I normally wouldn't care about because I wouldn't be able to *see* them--and it gave me the feeling that I was in someone's bonus rooms.  You know, the room middle-aged men with too much money get to add onto their houses and pretend they have a bar by putting up neons, a projector with "the game" on, and a shuffle board off to the side.  I recommend this place if you want to have access to a large selection of beers and don't care about ambiance and have already eaten dinner.  Oh, and they just started having brunch on Sunday's 10am-2pm.  Mimosas will be served.

fujG5iiQ0I0FS_myWNxi9A.text: Wonderful place! Bright, clean, and friendly atmosphere with televisions for sports. The two bartenders serving my husband and me this past Saturday were extremely friendly and very knowledgable about both beer and food. I loved that each beer had a sample size so you could try a variety without getting stuck with any beer you already know you dislike. I found a few beers I will definitely order in the future and am looking forward to sampling another 5 the next time I'm in. The bartender recommended getting anything with the pulled pork and I have to agree it was outstanding! My husband and I ordered the nachos with pork as an appetizer and ended up making it our meal after we saw its size. We even left some chips/cheese/tomatoes on the plate but every single scrap of the pork was gobbled up. There is a pulled pork sandwich on the menu too and I may try it next time. This place is a real gem. Go check it out!

e080olcnqhcEDhxzzMOCpA.text: We ventured here on a Saturday night as I was given a gift card from a friend. I warned my boyfriend that the drinks are great but the food may not be as good. Boy was I wrong. I had not been to Hough's in over 4 years and they changed their menu since my last visit. Not a ton of options but the design of the menu looks great. I went with a burger which came with blue cheese, onions and bacon plus a choice of a side. You could choose from fries, tater tots, or a salad. I went with a salad with honey mustard. Everything tasted delicious and the burger was cooked to perfection with lots of toppings. My boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles with tater tots. He loved it and it did look tasty. Of course the beer is the best part as they have tons of draft and bottle beer. What I love best is that you can get 4.7 oz pours which is perfect for me who likes to try a number of different beers. I got 4 samples all ranging from $2-$3 including a delicious sour beer. It was darker than the normal sour beers that I have tried before but I still really liked it. Also liked the Shiner Strawberry I sampled. Overall we had a fun date night, fine service and I want to go back to sample more beer!

a1fv6KUY1uc2blRgYgpSCw.text: Great selection of beer. That's a good start, although they were out of Flower Power IPA but found a nice surprise in a Copper Kettle dark IPA made right in their own brewery.  It was fifty cent wing night and good friend of Joe, Ross, was eagerly waiting to order his garlic wings. I looked over the menu and saw a build your own burger menu. Two vegan options, portobello mushrooms and a veggie patty. They also had beef, bison and another offering that I can't remember. All build your own burgers start at 7 bucks except the bison which is 9. Add ons are extra, cheese is 75 cents or a buck, veggies are 50 cents each, sauces are 50 cents, I'm sure it adds up and your burger could be 14 bucks if you go overboard. I decided on the hummus.   I got a huge bowl, complete with carrot sticks, celery, and pita, not baked though, soft and fresh. Unfortunately, the hummus was rather unremarkable, bland, and could have been made better with some garlic, some herbs, or even a bit of salt and pepper. I looked on the bar for salt shakers, or a bottle of tabasco, but none were to be found. Which is a shame, with all the cooking shows on TV that the cooks here can't properly season a dish.  Next time i'll build a burger and see what happens. Ross loved the six wings and devoured them with a Sam Adams Oktoberfest.   Hough's seems more like an Elk's lodge or Eagle's club. There's room for improvement, and I hope the cook finds the salt shaker.

TltuMMKfVaGGdv2WvbsVKg.text: Bring back the half off draft happy hour and ill give yinz 5 stars

dlxr3NM9aOmrv5k9JdIHHg.text: This place is great. Food, service, atmosphere. Couldn't ask for better. Love their brunch and their dinner service. Fantastic happy hour prices as well. I really want to comment on the service, though. Our server Laura, was phenomenal. Always on the ball with our drinks and food, but she was also inherently kind and genuine. Went above and beyond with all of our needs. I can honestly say because of her service and hospitality here at hough's, the quality of food, and selection of beer...I will always come back. Thank you!

BbNyTDXowwiG5QH1KZHW3Q.text: I've been here several times for Steelers games and other contests. The place is spacious though you never know when it'll get crowded. I've been there on various game days when it was inexplicably empty. Lots of wood-panelling and you're never unable to see the many flat screens mounted around the restaurant. Patrons do get nice and loud when the Steelers are playing.  Hough's calling-card is their huge selection of beer. Lots of beers on tap and you can get small samples to see which you like better. The food is standard American bar food - chicken fingers, fries, nachos, etc. The service is friendly and if anything gets messed up (hey, no one's perfect), they're quick to try to correct the mistake.

ReGsb6HG0N1_tglTbMcCiQ.text: I would add a star if they were not sooo understaffed on a Friday night.  UGH.  2 bartenders and no service bar tender.  Very few servers. Food was very good. Got the grilled cheese sliders. Very good. Wings were just ok. Seemed baked instead of fried. Not very crispy. Soft pretzels were cold. But good non the less. Beer was really good craft beer. First time in  this bar. Heard a lot of good things. I ordered beer that the bartender had to go into the beer room to get...???? Will be in again to try some other food, that looked amazing. Oh also. Could not tell the staff from the patrons. No uniforms? Shirts? Anything?

ekP8IN7finZ4zaYDr1Q0AQ.text: 2.0/5 - Burger: overcooked, but evenly cooked. 2.5/5 - Crab Cake burger  3.0/5 - Green Flash Saison Diego 2.0/5 - Weihenstephaner 1.5/5 - Creme Brulee Beer: very sugary bite with a bitter strong aftertaste

-uWIJ362gfqSORKBPkSG7A.text: I am so thoroughly disappointed with Hough's. I used to be a raving fan but have been treated very rudely at the bar on two out of my last five visits. Most recently I was asked to move my seat after my food order came. I obiliged thinking that I was doing something nice for a fellow patron but came to realize that I was being relocated so that servers who were off for the day could sit there. If there isn't a seat at the bar then sit your ass down at one of the many empty tables and don't bother your customers. I don't know what happened to all the nice guys that used to tend bar but I'm done with the surly attitude from the ladies that have been working there the last few months. Two stars because they still have a killer beer selection and I'm not a monster.

17aO20lfYUw_TZUSQCw6cA.text: I went her awhile ago for a quick meal, and the tater tot nachos were really good!! Seem to have a great beer selection too.

2GwaBX7HP95PpeSdAYF0lQ.text: I give Hough's 3/5 for the beer and the neighborhood bar feel.  Their beer selection is one of the best in town and if this was based on that alone I would have given 5/5.    The food there is basic pub fare and not great.  We tried the roasted Brussels sprouts app which was pretty terrible.  A great idea but poor execution at best.  The nachos were ok nachos.  Stick to the simple pub stuff if you eat here.    If you came to drink the beer you are at the right place!  Very wide selection of brews for all palates and pretty extensive draft list.  You will not be disappointed!

Wf4gI6flPAHTL6X6CS2NgQ.text: This place had the best customer service. I'm from clevand and they gave me a cup that said Great Lakes Cleveland ohio.  I need this place in my life.

kJKKAkXlnJ5aDjFDuPBAWw.text: Hough's is a salvation for anyone living in the lovely, but otherwise bar-devoid neighborhood of Greenfield. Lots and lots of beer, both in bottles and draft form. The beer list reads like a novel, with brewery, beer genre, standard price, growler price, and last but not least ABV conveniently listed for every option. The food is generally fantastic bar food. I particularly recommend any of the burgers or wings. You will order your wings, and then you might find yourself grumbling about why it hasn't come out yet. SETTLE DOWN, GRUMPYPANTS. It is taking a little longer because they're making them FRESH, and the extra care shows after they hit your lips.   During the week the place is almost exclusively populated by PSL athletes coming from their games at nearby Magee Field. On the weekends you have a fun-loving crowd ranging from 21 to 99. Shuffleboard. Closed on Sunday unless the Steelers are playing.  Only grievance is that the TV's aren't wonderfully situated for obsessive sports watching. On either side of the bar, the TV's are on the opposite walls, at a very low angle so often times you're watching the bartenders instead of the game. Best solution is to come with a group of friends, get a table, and passively watch the game on the projection in the corner.

jnBg8aNr8Su0QrNEAeku3Q.text: Let me preface by saying I have usually had good experiences and generally love this bar. It's close to where I live, and is generally a quite fun place (lots of events, including trivia night, drunkin pumpkins and such). We love to invite our friends and hang out, and the bartenders are generally decent.  All I have to say  is be weary of their specials.The first time I figured it was a mistake and let it slide. However the second time I found a mistake by them it  annoyed me enough that I wanted to create a yelp account to post about it. Twice now I've been burned by their 4 dollar happy hour. I've got a couple drinks, and then when I get my bill I notice some of them are full price. Upon letting the bartender know this last time about it the response I got was, "oh yeah some high alcohol beers aren't subject to happy hour prices, I did notice one beer is 1/2 off that shouldn't be.. how about I just look the other way for that?". Um what? I looked at the menu and there was no indication of any special pricing, nor did the bartenders ever say anything.   Lame. For advertising themselves as a neighborhood bar, they sure are seeming less and less friendly.

TGdjq1A9gKSnOcnoLv2-Xg.text: How I have never been to this bar until last week is beyond me. It's 0.1 miles away from home! So there is something good that came out of this Snowmageddon of 2010, at least for me ;)  I was impressed by the huge beer selection they have, there are a few taps (5 or 6) and 3 huge fridges with bottled stuff at the end of the bar. Unlike some other places I've been to, here they print all the bottled beers in a menu; so it's easy to see what they have and made your pick. I've also tried an appetizer here, fried pirogies with sour cream, they were tasty but that's as far as I made it into the food menu (they do offer lunch, dunner and even brunch now)  They also have darts and shuffleboard, and a big TV to watch Lakers games on. And if that's not enough, Fridays are $4 margaritas and they are huge. This Saturday they had a 21A beer tasting, Rogue tasting earlier this year. All in all, pretty amazing for a bar so close to home and the prices are obviously lower than Southside (and the crowd a ton more bearable)

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Welcome mat

05vkUnLZ1ZC4IVoVF9ys6Q.text: Houghs flies under the radar in the Pittsburgh beer scene. Thankfully so, as I really didnt want to wade through crowds of pretentious yuppies in the Sharp Edge.  They have a fantastic draft and bottle selection. A great redeeming quality is the ability to get sampler flights, which is awesome for trying new beers.  They have a plethora of televisions for sports viewing, as well as large and small tables for either a personal setting or communal setting.  I cannot comment on the food, but given what I have witness thus far, I will return.  Stay thirsty my friends.

kXrGrqNdi68rSLKqdPEPiA.text: Went on a weekday evening and the place had a nice comfortable feel to it.  Good selection of beers in a well laid out beer menu.  Wasn't wow'd by the food but I had made a poor choice.  Sports bar so plenty of TV's, plus wifi.  Parking was a bear but that's to be expected.  I'm definitely going again (and making a different food choice).

mId8NZu09a-PG0qNakho0A.text: I went here on Saturday to watch the Pens with boyfriend and another couple. Great place to watch the game. Several TV's and a giant wall projector PLUS they turn the sound on for the game! Woot! Maybe it was just because we were playing the Flyers, but everyone in Hough's was cheering and into the game which made the atmosphere awesome.  On to the important things...  Ridiculously awesome beer selection -- 50-60 on tap and hundreds of bottles which was, at first, quite overwhelming (oh the decision making!!) but I'm certainly not complaining.  I think this was just a fluke, but the taps weren't working on the first 2 beers my boyfriend ordered and on one of the beers our friend ordered. With so many choices it wasn't really a problem, but certainly worth noting.    Apps:: We started with Buffalo Chicken Dip which was A-mazing but I do wish the quality of the tortilla chips were a bit better... Seriously, not a big deal though. The dip more than made up for it.  We also ordered the Mac 'n Cheese Bites. They were okay...   Entree:: I had the Chicken Cheesesteak with coleslaw as a side. Awesome, super delicious. I may have wolfed it in down in like 3 minutes... it happens. The chicken was sliced thin and all the cheese was nice and melted to perfection. Boyfriend had Benko Burger which he really enjoyed. The quality of the meat was great, very juicy and cooked just how he liked. The toppings were great as well. Fries were standard but yummy. Chipotle wings received a really good review as did another burger... I cannot remember for the life of me what specific type of burger our friend ordered but I do recall him saying it was really good.   Overall, we will certainly be back to watch some Playoff Hockey and indulged in delicious food and beers very soon!

GvQdParJPPYEnFeCj2J3Lw.text: I went to Hough's with a group of 4 for the first time to watch a Pens playoff game. Great sports bar atmosphere and drink selection. I ate the chicken and waffles sandwich with the tots--amazing! Our server was friendly, street parking was easy to find, and there were plenty of tables and TVs (they even have a big screen). We will definitely be returning in the future to cheer on our Pittsburgh sports teams!

GRKe3qYhiNK18suF0I1PWw.text: Three stars because some entrees are amazing, and some are just...not. Sometimes the services is fantastic, other times it's terrible. To me, it all averages out to a 3-star experience.  The very best thing about Hough's is Sunday brunch. Do yourself a favor and try it sometime. It's a great place to eat late and stay for Sunday afternoon sports.

xVdb0hNBzh-qi_X3N2I7nQ.text: Tucked away in Greenfield, Hough's is surprisingly delightful. Upon entering you would think this was like any sports bar, but the emphasis on beer is commendable. Never have I been disappointed by the variety at Hough's.  This is a bar first, and a restaurant second. They keep the taps clean, and as a result nowhere does beer taste this good. The food is still fantastic though. A few highlights are the reuben, pulled pork, and tatchos, though many others have not disappointed me.   Without a doubt I recommend Hough's to anyone that passes through Greenfield. With a welcoming, knowledgeable staff, and a beer selection to rival all (difficult to do even in Pittsburgh) Hough's manages to have the atmosphere of a neighborhood bar where a beer connoisseur feels welcome.

HueeJzVQvplMxGbNnu9E9w.text: I recently visited Hough's again after hearing the new food menu is finally edible.  The food was great.  I finally enjoyed both my drinks and my meal.  The new food menu is really good.  Everyone I was with agreed.  We'd always been disappointed with the food in the past but were finally happy this time.

9bHqddGCBlzdDN4HjArVVA.text: Great beer selection.  Just went there for Sunday brunch.  The brunch selections provide a good amount of food for great value (most meals run around $6).  The bartender/waiter was a chill guy and provided great service.  I will definitely be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Pittsburgh Dog--hot dog infused with pepper jack cheese and wrapped in bacon. Served a pretzel bun.
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The &#34;Hough&#39;s Big Breakfast&#34; meal

vn-52RAiEdgMNuNqHIbtRw.text: Great beer selection and good service... just have to say that the food was nothing spectacular.  I would give them 4 stars if the food was just a tad better.   I had the grilled cheese with apple sauce (although she brought me coleslaw instead but then righted this almost immediately), good, but not great.  We had the zucchini planks (good), Chicken tenders (decent) with BBQ sauce (NOT GOOD at all), homemade chips (too well done/hard for how thick they were cut), and I am not certain of what my husband had... think a chicken sandwich.  If it was anything great, I would remember it.    This is a great place to go watch a game, have a few drinks with friends... but not the best.

BAkLxfCfhOHFto66WdrjEA.text: I have serval friends that love this place and it's hopping on a friday night for sure. I just had a bad experience and will have to try them again. My wife wrote all about it in her review so I won't go into great detail but we got a bad plate of nachos that were pretty much inedible.   Other than the disappointment over the Nachos the Beer select was awesome and they seems to have a nice well rounded selection. I settled in with a Left Hand Milk Stout which is always a good choice. They also have table top shuffle board which I didn't get a chance to play when I visited but I'm sure is also fun.   If you are in the Neighborhood and find yourself craving a Beer give this place a go. Maybe pass on the Cheese Nachos, especially if it's close to kitchen closing time.

vNe_P44sQsCeBSH7tzVIwA.text: If you love craft beer, stop reading and get your behind to Houghs. In terms of selection and quality, you will be happier than a kid with a sugar high in a candy store. Most of the bartenders have a genuine passion for craft beer and, thus, have a deep knowledge on the subject. They are clutch when you are indecisive on what beer to pick (just one look at the beer menu and you will see how easy that is).  I love the beer, staff, and atmosphere; however, i withheld a star becuase of food.  The burgers, wings, and other items are solid, but the menu items overall will never have you raving about them. I have also gone to their sunday brunch a few times, which everything tasted great and was very reasonably priced. I would recommend going to try the brunch at least once.  Take your growlers on monday and get 5 bucks off your refill!

O-d19o0leRRBeXsF2d9hgw.text: From the outside you think Hough's is going to be totally smokey and gross inside, with nothing but Miller Lite on tap. You're a little scared by Hough's. Then, one day, you throw caution to the wind, and walk in. As a serious, collegiate beer drinker, you immediately fall in love. All you've wanted in a bar is here. A single tear falls to the floor.    How could I list all the things I love? I will pare it down to 10.  First of all, it's family run, and they family is full of nice people. I mean, who wants to frequent an establishment run by a family full of jerks? Not me. They always swing by to chat me and hubby up, by name. Secondly, there is a wall of taps. Third, they have great prices, and there's always a special going on. Fourth, no smoke! Fifth, a wall of taps, Sixth, they have TVs with sports, but I wouldn't call it a "sports bar." Seventh, the interior is nice, and not at all cheap or worn-down. Eighth, Ninth, and Tenth (drum roll) wall o' taps!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Hough's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So many beers!

1vUCuvP1r_Vw1O94z13IUw.text: Perhaps, I would have enjoyed this place if I was a big drinker. I was here with a group prior to heading to the Escape Room next door, and the food was just barely passable. I had a burger; no one asked for a temperature and it came out dry and burnt. This was just a smidge better than Burger King but double the price.

3sjHnPGR_zJCi2BIXPbLiQ.text: Hough's is a hidden gem. Huge selection of beer, great bar food, plenty of seating, and lots of televisions to watch local sports.   I found some great beers on the menu, including Delirium Tremens, voted one of the best beers in the world. The food is good for bar food. I had the soft pretzel sticks, which were very moist and flavorful, and the Reuben. Other menu items include haluski, a pittsburgh classic, and all kinds of burgers.   Street parking only but it's not usually a problem. Tuesday night is trivia night, and they give away lots of prizes. Go check it out!

hnIpCgo_fT4DkvkiRNSBeA.text: Great food, great drinks and great atmosphere. Went for Sunday brunch, had the Hash- was so good for my lingering hangover! Bloody Mary bar until 3 on Sunday, with endless beers to choose from. Phenomenal find.

QGGlZQ4ZfbsN3zllFn8u4w.text: Great place!!! Awesome selection of beers. They even have a brew it yourself copper kettle brewing where you make your own beer and labor. Very cool.

lasr48ef2JjKoiutKWzLMw.text: Great food! Cozy atmosphere. The waiter was fun, consistent and courteous. Good brews. Many tvs. And a clean place. No booths, my favorite but high and low tables. Reasonably priced. I'll be back!

YIFtCt6Io6oC8yd98HAajw.text: My fiance and I went there yesterday to get dinner and drinks. We entered Hough's around 8pm. Unfortunately, we forgot it was game 7 for the Pens Stanley Cup playoffs so the place was packed. We stood at the door waiting to get seated. Since we had never been there before we did not know the routine. There were no signs saying please wait to be seated or please seat yourself. So we waited a bit in the meantime two or three servers both male and female both walked passed us never saying a word or acknowledging our presence . My fiance attempted to get the attention of one of the waiters but she brushed on by like he didn't exist. I thought my fiance was going to explode so we left.   I am willing to give the place the benefit of the doubt. Frankly, it was a busy evening. We will attempt to go back on a night there is no game or event. I have heard great things about the beer selection at this place. I hope next time it doesn't disappoint!!!

CFtnxeKTmh5FcKl_TbAcUQ.text: Sometimes it's my favorite place in Pittsburgh.   Sometimes it's not.     Most times I go there, they are currently "out" of the beer I select from their menu of beer on tap.  Not sure if this is due to outdated menus or them trying to convey an image that they have a billion beers on tap.    However, when they do have the beer I want - always amazing.  And their foods pretty great too.  Awesome sports bar type atmosphere.    Go here if you haven't.

i5PN6UGn3G4aImOMpSY5iw.text: We love Hough's.  Huge beer selection, with frequent specials (although sometimes I find myself surprised that they can have such a huge selection with so few beers that I would call "really good").  The food is pretty good, with a tasty veggie burger on the menu.  The prices aren't great but they aren't too exorbitant.  Tuesday night bar trivia is a lot of fun if you get a good group together.  Also?  Non-smoking, which I love.  It shouldn't be a bonus to get to leave a bar not stinking like a chimney, but sadly in PGH it is.  Probably the best thing about this place is its general neighborhood feeling - like everyone is a regular.  The worst thing, though, is the neighborhood it's in!  Not that we don't like Greenfield, it's just that it's so far away from everything.  Getting home via bus usually means either a very long walk followed by a very long ride that winds all over the city, or else leaving by 9 or 9:30 to catch the better routes.  We have a car, but generally don't want to go to a bar and then drive home.  So I guess that could be consTrued as either a complaint about location, or a complaint about the Allegheny County Port Authority routes!  Either way, we do try to come back, but we don't get there as often as we'd like.

9eMCLXvj9i4yiov7OrjaBg.text: We were there for brunch today as well as it being Valentine's Day it was also our anniversary. Our waitresses name was Laura she was friendly knowledgeable and make great recommendations for our visit. The food was good and we enjoy the atmosphere but we will keep coming back just based on the service alone thank you Laura!

kysBtHBND-oJFeY9rY1Pxw.text: Hough's (pronounced Huff's) is a little gem located in Greenfield.   I think the food is standard bar food and nothing special.  What I like is the HUGE selection of draft beers (over 60!), the ability to purchase flights, samples, and fill up your growler.  @Curtis G and I were here for a beer tasting after an urban hike with Venture Outdoors (amazing, btw).  The servers were attentive and made a nice first impression.  There is at least one TV if not two on every wall, so Hough's is def. a place to catch a sporting event.  Do I recommend making a special trip to Hough's for beer?  No, but if you happen to be in Greenfield or want to chill out somewhere enjoying a wide selection of beers while watching a game, def. stop by for a few brews.

xgzsEp1_kr0FpakxK72PnQ.text: This place is all about the beer so if you are not a drinker this place can be skipped.  The food used to be better than my last visit and now is just barely acceptable bar quality food. I got a burger that was forgettable before finishing it.  The service is a bright spot and is generally quite good.  Did I mention the beer selection? It's huge.

uL1eXlesKaNwxjEksG2a5Q.text: Oh, Hough's.  You put up with the flood of PSL players after the multitude of kickball and softball games without complaint.  I'm lucky that my kickball nights line up with flight nights.    Hough's is also part of a small brewery (Copper Kettle Pgh), offering burghers some amazing local offerings.  My favorite is the Cuckoo Clock IPA.  It's a perfect balance of hoppy bitterness, malt, and has a high abv kick to finish. I wish they offered it all year round! (Ahem... wink wink nudge nudge, Copper Kettle PGH!)    After a game, my team typically gets a few appetizers with our beers, and Hough's has a large amount of decently priced apps to accommodate. Their buffalo chicken dip is one of the best (although I've had better spinach dips elsewhere), and their large nachos with chicken can feed a few of our hungry players post-win.    Boyfriend and I have also gone to Hough's for a few weekday dinners, taking advantage of their 4-6pm happy hour.  Drafts are half off, and apps/well drinks are a dollar off. Not bad!    If you look at their online or in-house chalkboard calendar, there is always something going on.  Trivia, flight nights, gameday specials, you name it.    I would happily give Hough's a five-star review if it weren't for ONE thing... their burgers.  And by that I mean the beef, as the crab cake and Portobello "burgers" have always been just fine.  The beef that they use is very low quality... it reminds me of the cheap patties they served at lunch in high school.  I'm sorry, but at around ~$10 including toppings, they really need to kick up the quality of their meat.   But that's really the only problem I have with this otherwise fantastic place!

0CVqn74HzwMIH2hzPbyrzw.text: I love this place for the beer list and beer specials.  Its hard to beat the number of beers they have on tap, and they are all really good.  The food is typical bar food; perfectly acceptable but not a reason to go in and of itself.  The beer list is what keeps me coming back.

9R4Jv3FSGyCJcY_nkbtliQ.text: The beer selection is incredible and I love how they sell smaller "sample" pours of everything on tap, which happens to be roughly 60 beers (and tons more in bottles). This makes it easier to taste a wide variety of beers, without becoming drunk and broke in the process. I normally get their "BBBBLT", which is your standard BLT sandwich with a very high grade thick cut bacon. If you're a bacon lover, this dish will hit the spot.  If you pay attention inside Hough's, you'll notice the Copper Kettle brewery through a set of glass doors joined to the building. This is an additional business, allowing groups of people to brew their own beer for a fee.
